DataElement.preferredName: Person Laboratory Procedure Alkaline Phosphatase Measurement Disease or Disorder Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A response to determine eligibility for clinical trial participation for questions related to the measurement of alkaline phosphatase present in a sample with any abnormal medical condition of the patient.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Laboratory Procedure Alkaline Phosphatase Measurement Disease or Disorder Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A human being._Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._A quantitative measurement of alkaline phosphatase present in a sample._Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A human being.:Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredName: Alkaline Phosphatase Measurement Disease or Disorder Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: A quantitative measurement of alkaline phosphatase present in a sample.:Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. Concepts.definition: A quantitative measurement of alkaline phosphatase present in a sample.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Is pre-study alkaline phospha
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study alkaline phosphatase less than or equal to 2.5 x upper limit of normal or less than or equal to 5 x upper limit of normal if liver involvement or bone metastases?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study alkaline phosphatase less than or equal to 2.5 x upper limit of normal or less than or equal to 5 x upper limit of normal if documented liver involvement or bone metastases?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study alkaline phosphatase less than or equal to 2.5 x upper limit of normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study alkaline phosphatase less than or equal to 2 x upper limit of normal or less than or equal to 5 x upper limit of normal for patients with documented liver involvement or bone metastases?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study alkaline phosphatase less than 2.0 x upper limit of normal (or less than 3.0 x upper limit of normal if liver or bone disease is present)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study alkaline phosphatase less than 2.0 x upper limit of normal (if liver or bone metastases are present, less than 3.0 x upper limit of normal)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study alkaline phosphatase less than or equal to 2.5 x upper limit of normal (or less than or equal to 5 x upper limit of normal for patients with documented liver involvement or bone metastases)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study alkaline phosphatase less than or equal to 3.0 x institutional upper limit of normal or less than or equal to 5 x upper limit of normal if documented bone metastases?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study alkaline phosphatase less than 2.0 x institutional upper limit of normal (or less than 3.0 x upper limit of normal if liver or bone metastases are present)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is alkaline phosphatase less than or equal to 3 x upper limit of normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study alkaline phosphatase less than or equal to 3 x institutional upper limit of normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study alkaline phosphatase less than or equal to 2.5 x institutional ULN (or less than or equal to 5 x upper limit of reference range if considered to be related to liver or bone metastases by the PI)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study alkaline phosphatase less than or equal to 2 x institutional upper limit of normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study alkaline phosphatase less than or equal to 2.5 x upper limit of normal (or less than or equal to 5 x upper limit of normal for patients with documented liver involvement or bone metastases) within 14 days prior to study registration?

DataElement.administrativeNotes: 2023.6.23 Special character corrected per ticket request CADSR0002546. ak
